title: Online Course Based on the Educational Reconstruction Model (MER) for Solid-State Chemistry Concept Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Knowledge of General Chemistry and Understanding of Atomic Structure
context.additional_context: Activity design optimized for smartphone-based learning environments and implementation of formative assessment-centered feedback systems

learning_goals: Learners can explain core solid-state chemistry concepts (crystal structures, bonding characteristics, band gaps, etc.) with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can connect solid-state chemistry principles to real-world examples (e.g., semiconductor materials, ionic conductors) at a conceptual level.
Learners improve misconception correction rates by over 60% through MER (Model-Evidence-Refinement)-based learning activities (thought experiments, modeling, case analysis).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
